column2: What is the main goal of endpoint security?
column3: Protect individual devices from threats

column2: Which of the following is an example of an endpoint?
column3: Laptop

column2: Which type of software is commonly used to detect and remove malware on endpoints?
column3: Antivirus/anti-malware

column2: Why is it risky to use outdated operating systems on endpoints?
column3: They no longer receive security updates

column2: What is the purpose of endpoint encryption?
column3: Protect data on the device if it is lost or stolen

column2: Which is a good example of strong endpoint authentication?
column3: Password + biometric or token

column2: Why are local administrator accounts on endpoints a security risk?
column3: Attackers can gain full control if compromised

column2: What is application whitelisting?
column3: Allowing only approved applications to run

column2: Which feature helps prevent unauthorized software installation on endpoints?
column3: Standard user accounts and application control

column2: What is patch management for endpoints?
column3: Regularly applying updates and fixes

column2: Why is automatic update configuration important on endpoints?
column3: Ensures timely security patches

column2: Which of these is an example of endpoint hardening?
column3: Disabling unused services and ports

column2: Why are USB storage devices a security concern on endpoints?
column3: They can introduce malware or steal data

column2: Which control helps detect suspicious behavior on endpoints beyond known signatures?
column3: Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR)

column2: What is a common sign that an endpoint may be compromised?
column3: Unusual CPU/network usage and unknown processes

column2: Why should users not run as local admin on daily basis?
column3: It increases risk of malware installation and misconfigurations

column2: Which practice helps protect endpoints from phishing emails?
column3: User awareness training and email filtering

column2: What is disk full-disk encryption mainly protecting against?
column3: Data theft from lost or stolen devices

column2: Which of the following should be disabled or restricted in documents to reduce malware risk?
column3: Untrusted macros

column2: Why is endpoint inventory important?
column3: To know which devices exist and their security state

column2: What should be done before allowing a new endpoint onto the corporate network?
column3: Verify it meets security baseline (patches

column2: Why is logging important on endpoints?
column3: To support investigations and detect anomalies

column2: Which security control can isolate suspicious endpoint behavior automatically?
column3: EDR with automated containment

column2: What is a common method to protect corporate data on BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) endpoints?
column3: Use mobile device management (MDM) and app containers

column2: Why is it important to disable unused network services on endpoints?
column3: Reduces attack surface

column2: What does "least privilege" mean for endpoint users?
column3: Give minimum rights needed to do their job

column2: Which of these is a good practice for endpoint local firewall configuration?
column3: Block unnecessary inbound traffic

column2: What is the purpose of host-based intrusion prevention (HIPS)?
column3: Block suspicious behavior on the endpoint

column2: Why should default local admin passwords not be shared across endpoints?
column3: A compromise on one device exposes all others

column2: Which method helps protect endpoints from ransomware?
column3: Regular backups + patching + limited privileges

column2: Why is application control important for endpoint security?
column3: Prevents unauthorized or risky apps from running

column2: Which setting on email clients reduces risk from malicious attachments?
column3: Block or warn on executable attachments

column2: Why is browser hardening important on endpoints?
column3: Browsers are a common attack vector

column2: Which of these helps prevent keylogger attacks?
column3: Using endpoint protection and avoiding unknown installs

column2: Why should remote desktop access to endpoints be restricted?
column3: Attackers can use exposed RDP to take over devices

column2: Which is a practical control for endpoints used by many different users (e.g. labs)?
column3: Use standard images and regular re-imaging

column2: Why is securing local browser passwords important?
column3: Compromise can expose many application logins

column2: Which policy helps reduce risk when employees leave the organization?
column3: Promptly disable accounts and revoke access

column2: Why is endpoint backup important?
column3: Allows recovery from ransomware or hardware failure

column2: What does "EDR" stand for?
column3: Endpoint Detection and Response

column2: Why should public Wi‑Fi usage on endpoints be controlled?
column3: It may expose traffic to interception

column2: Which is a good practice for handling lost or stolen endpoints?
column3: Remotely wipe if possible and revoke access

column2: Why are local browser extensions a security concern?
column3: Malicious extensions can steal data or inject code

column2: Which measure helps ensure new endpoints are deployed securely?
column3: Use a hardened gold image with baseline controls
